content.description:
Short north-facing pocketed wall on a fin of rock. The Drunkenmaster forgot what he named the line, so we came up with this new name (Short Memory) as a replacement.

Bit of a crux rounding the bulge at the second bolt with many ways of going about it. Two bolt anchor (no lower-offs), scramble off left.
content.location: North facing wall on Memorial Rock.

content.description:
Crazy pocketed wall with some weird/unique movement. The belayer should back clean the first bolt to avoid rope drag. Also be careful to avoid the hollow flake left of the third bolt. You can easily reach past it to some pockets just above.

Drunkenmaster forgot what he named this one so we agreed on a replacement name, Pockets of Memory.
content.location: Rightward pocketed route on the north face. Three of the four bolts are visible from the ground.

content.description:
Offwidth roof crack. The slab below is unfortunately close to the crack (the only thing keeping this from being four stars). For full value, sit-start in the back of the roof at a hidden jug. The stand start notably drops the grade and worthiness. Keep powering through the roof until you can slot a much needed fist (big fists rejoice). Continue to the top with more pumpy jamming.

For an anchor, I used 1/2" ClimbTech removable bolts, but anybody would be welcome to add perminent bolts. The anchor ledge is easily accessed with a quick scramble up the right side.

The FA was done as a ground-up onsight. The name came because the cove seemed to be the only place free of smoke along our long drive along the coast.
content.location: Towards the southern end of Memorial Rock.

content.description: Black slab rising from a boulder on the water's edge. The 316 grade 1/2" wedge bolts appear to be in excellent condition.
content.location: North facing slab on the Memorial Boulder.
